metadata.title: CVE-2018-20505 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: SQLite 3.25.2, when queries are run on a table with a malformed PRIMARYKEY, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (applicationcrash) by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such asin certain WebSQL use cases).

criterions.comment: sqlite3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
